greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Symmetric matrix based on A007598(n+1), by antidiagonals.
comment: Let s=A007598(n+1) (squared Fibonacci numbers, beginning with F(2)), and let T be the infinite square matrix whose n-th row is formed by putting n-1 zeros before the terms of s.  Let T' be the transpose of T.  Then A203003 represents the matrix product M=T'*T.  M is the self-fusion matrix of s, as defined at A193722.  See A203004 for characteristic polynomials of principal submatrices of M, with interlacing zeros.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 27 2011
